markdown:
<title level="1" right="Creature Family">[Elemental, Water](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=412)</title>

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 148 <sup>1.1</sup>

Water elementals can be very destructive, but often not intentionally so; just as water can bring life to mortals in need, its waves can pound shores and rains can flood cities. Water elementals are similarly difficult to predict.

<title level="2">Members</title>
[Brine Shark](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2989) (Creature 3), [Elemental Tsunami](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2992) (Creature 11), [Living Waterfall](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2990) (Creature 5), [Quatoid](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2991) (Creature 7)

<title level="2" right="Creature Family Group">Elemental</title>

**Related Families**
[Elemental, Air](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=41), [Elemental, Air](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=408), [Elemental, Earth](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=42), [Elemental, Earth](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=409), [Elemental, Fire](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=43), [Elemental, Fire](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=410), [Elemental, Mephit](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=44), [Elemental, Metal](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=343), [Elemental, Scamp](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=411), [Elemental, Water](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=45), [Elemental, Wisp](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=232), [Elemental, Wood](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=345)
